title: How to Tie a Perfect Sash Bow on a Dress

steps.content: Adjust the sash and pull it around the waist of the dress until you have an equal length of ribbon to work with on both sides. [1] X Research source If the dress comes with the sash already attached, it will likely already be equal.
Bring the left side (side A) of the sash over the right side (side B). [2] X Research source The two lengths of the sash should be crossed over each other like an “X.” [3] X Research source
Insert side A underneath side B and pull to tighten. [4] X Research source Make sure the sash is comfortable and is the desired tightness for the person wearing the dress.
Take the length of side B and form a loop. [5] X Research source Make it the size you want your bow to be. [6] X Research source
Bring side A around the loop you’ve made with side B, just as you would with shoelaces. [7] X Research source
Feed side A through the small opening between the loop and the original knot, like you would when tying shoelaces. [8] X Research source
Keep pulling side A through the opening until it forms a loop. [9] X Research source Pull until the loop is the same size as the loop on the other side.
Pull the loops until they are centered and even, and the knot is snug. [10] X Research source Now you have the perfect sash bow for any event!
